_sendMessage

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns a lower limit on gas limit for the particular message data
@param _data calldata passed to the executor on the other side
nodes.name: getMinimumGasUsage

statements.operations:
{
    let ptr := add(header, mload(header))
    mstore(ptr, dstChainId)
    mstore(sub(ptr, dstChainIdLength), srcChainId)
    mstore(add(header, 79), _dataType)
    mstore(add(header, 78), dstChainIdLength)
    mstore(add(header, 77), srcChainIdLength)
    mstore(add(header, 76), _gas)
    mstore(add(header, 72), _contract)
    mstore(add(header, 52), caller())
    mstore(add(header, 32), _messageId)
}

_packHeader

attributes.operations:
{
    let ptr := add(header, mload(header))
    mstore(ptr, dstChainId)
    mstore(sub(ptr, dstChainIdLength), srcChainId)
    mstore(add(header, 79), _dataType)
    mstore(add(header, 78), dstChainIdLength)
    mstore(add(header, 77), srcChainIdLength)
    mstore(add(header, 76), _gas)
    mstore(add(header, 72), _contract)
    mstore(add(header, 52), caller())
    mstore(add(header, 32), _messageId)
}

attributes.name: _getNewMessageId

allowReentrantRequests().return: true, if reentrant requests are allowed.

decimalShift().details: Returns the value of foreign-to-home decimal shift.

destinationChainId().return: chain id for the destination network

failedMessageDataHash(bytes32).details: Returns a data hash of the failed message that came from the other side. NOTE: dataHash was used previously to identify outgoing message before AMB message id was introduced. It is kept for backwards compatibility with old mediators contracts.

params._messageId: id of the message from the other side that triggered a call.

failedMessageReceiver(bytes32).details: Returns a receiver address of the failed message that came from the other side.

params._messageId: id of the message from the other side that triggered a call.

failedMessageSender(bytes32).details: Returns a sender address of the failed message that came from the other side.

params._messageId: id of the message from the other side that triggered a call.

failedMessageSender(bytes32).return: sender address on the other side.

getMinimumGasUsage(bytes).details: Returns a lower limit on gas limit for the particular message data

params._data: calldata passed to the executor on the other side

params._destinationChainId: chain id of a network where all outgoing messages are directed
params._gasPrice: default gas price used by oracles for sending transactions in this network
params._maxGasPerTx: maximum amount of gas per one message execution
params._requiredBlockConfirmations: number of block confirmations oracle will wait before processing passed messages
params._sourceChainId: chain id of a network where this contract is deployed

messageCallStatus(bytes32).details: Returns a status of the message that came from the other side.

params._messageId: id of the message from the other side that triggered a call.

messageId().details: Returns an id of the currently processed message.
messageId().return: id of the message that originated on the other side.

messageSender().details: Returns an address of the sender on the other side for the currently processed message. Can be used by executors for getting other side caller address.
messageSender().return: address of the sender on the other side.

messageSourceChainId().details: Returns an originating chain id of the currently processed message.
messageSourceChainId().return: source chain id of the message that originated on the other side.

owner().details: Tells the address of the owner

requireToPassMessage(address,bytes,uint2.details: Requests message relay to the opposite network

params._contract: executor address on the other side
params._data: calldata passed to the executor on the other side
params._gas: gas limit used on the other network for executing a message

params._enable: true, if reentrant requests are allowed.

setGasPrice(uint256).details: Public setter for fallback gas price value. Only bridge owner can call this method.

params._gasPrice: new value for the gas price.

sourceChainId().return: chain id for the current network

transactionHash().details: Returns an id of the currently processed message. NOTE: transactionHash was used previously to identify incoming message before AMB message id was introduced. It is kept for backwards compatibility with old mediators contracts, although it doesn't return txHash anymore.
transactionHash().return: id of the message that originated on the other side.

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: the address to transfer ownership to.

allowReentrantRequests().notice: Tells if passing reentrant requests is allowed.

destinationChainId().notice: Internal function for retrieving chain id for the destination network

setAllowReentrantRequests(bool).notice: Sets the flag to allow passing new AMB requests in the opposite direction, while other AMB message is being processed. Only owner can call this method.

setChainIds(uint256,uint256).notice: Updates chain ids of used networks

sourceChainId().notice: Internal function for retrieving chain id for the source network
